subject: Re: Preview of our new Specialist Referral Platform
preview: @jona yes, no need to track this one. In fact, I should be sending them to the Smart Referral helpscout. Thanks

full_threads.body: @jona yes, no need to track this one. In fact, I should be sending them to the Smart Referral helpscout. Thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body: @rica can you please try this ticket? Thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath - looks great.

Just a few small changes.

For "send an email" - it seems to list my personal email address (njufas@gmail.com <mailto:njufas@gmail.com>). I don't use this address for patients and try not to publish it at all online. Through my own website, I have a contact form, rather than allowing direct sending of emails (to avoid spam). Maybe just best to avoid this and use the contact form at the bottom of the page? My practice email address though is reception@drnicholasjufas.com.au <mailto:reception@drnicholasjufas.com.au> - can it go to this?

For hospitals, Chatswood Private Hospital is missing.

And finally for Consultation rooms, there is nothing listed. Is it possible to add my two locations at Gladesville (primary) and Neutral Bay (secondary)?

Thanks again Heath, much appreciated.

On Tue, Aug 4, 2020 at 3:51 PM Heath Maguire - WP Perk <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
Hi Nicholas,

Ok great, confirming we have created your free listing. You can view it here: https://smartreferral.com.au/specialist/nicholas-jufas/ <https://smartreferral.com.au/specialist/nicholas-jufas/>

Please advise if you would like any changes?

Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
DIRECTOR

Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134>
Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
Email: heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>

<https://wpperk.com/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WPPerk> <https://wolfiq.com.au/?utm_source=Email&utm_medium=Signature&utm_campaign=WPPerk>

> On 4 Aug 2020, at 12:31 pm, Nicholas Jufas <njufas@gmail.com <mailto:njufas@gmail.com>> wrote:
>
> Thanks for the offer for a Directory listing Heath, happy to take you up on that. If you need any further information please let me know.
>
> Nicholas
>
> On Mon, Aug 3, 2020 at 7:05 PM Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
> Hi Nicholas,
>
> Thanks for getting back to me, I completely understand your position. All good and thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback, I'm certainly grateful and not taking it for granted.
>
> Let me know if you would like us to create a free listing for you as a Directory Member? I'll be more than happy to.
>
> Also, if there are any ENT specialists that you feel could benefit from the platform, please feel free to let me know or to send them our link.
>
> Thanks again and speak soon,
>
>
>
> On Mon, Aug 3, 2020 at 5:26 PM Nicholas Jufas <njufas@gmail.com <mailto:njufas@gmail.com>> wrote:
> Thanks for the reply Heath. At the moment, I'm very happy with my referral network and the casemix I'm operating on. As time goes by, I find that my referrers have more and more insight into the types of patients that I generally operate on based on who they have referred to me and feedback I directly give them. For now, I would find it hard to justify the additional cost of the smartreferral system, particularly with the future uncertainly surrounding COVID.
>
> Thanks again for thinking of me.
>
> Nicholas
>
> On Mon, Aug 3, 2020 at 1:39 PM Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
> Hi Nicholas,
>
> Ok great, thanks for getting back to me and for the points, this is all extremely helpful.
>
> As you are the only practitioner in your clinic, then the Specialist Membership would be best for you. It still enables you to have your own page/microsite on the platform and receive referral letters. I will also enable you to publish articles on the site (normally reserved for the Clinic Members) if that's of interest to you. This is a good way to represent your domain knowledge online.
>
> In response:
> Completely agree that this platform suits a new surgeon who may be trying to fill their books. However, for an established specialist like yourself, the system gives you the ability to fill your waitlist with procedures that you most like to perform. E.g procedures that you are particularly well suited to, have a higher level of interest in or simply procedures that make good business sense.
> Also a valid point. I'm sure some of the GPs that you currently work with had a learning curve of somesort, whereby they learned what type of conditions you treat and how best to detail them. Smart Referrals gives you 'big brother' access to review and engage with only the most relevant referrals to your practice. It's a case of would you rather receive some potentially new patients and referrer relationships, or just carry on with your current referral network. Like you, I too have built my business on word of mouth. It's an amazing way to grow a business (as it's all based on your merits), but it does present a challenge as we become reliant on referral networks that are largely outside of our control. By engaging with a system like Smart Referral, you are putting measures in place to reduce reliance on existing networks and to prop them up with complimentary avenues.
> When a patient uploads their referral letter, we only send it to specialists within a 30km radius. We will reduce this down to 15/20km radius as we open up to more doctors within the same specialisation. So far as if they like you or not, well that is why the platform exists, to give patients choice. They will likely 'Google' you anyway, even if they have received a direct GP referral letter. Smart Referrals enables you to have full control over the information they read about you online and avoids things like ratings and reviews. The information is presented to the patient in a consistent format, enabling them to compare 'apples with apples'.
> I hope the above makes sense. We will try and work more of this information into the website to further help communicate the overall benefits.
>
> If you would like to join us, here is a direct link with the offer I mention above: https://smartreferral.com.au/?add-to-cart=1138&variation_id=1140&attribute=specialist-member <https://smartreferral.com.au/?add-to-cart=1138&variation_id=1140&attribute=specialist-member> It would be great to have you onboard to represent both the north and Inner West. Also any extra feedback will be greatly appreciated.
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
>
>
>
>
> On Sun, Aug 2, 2020 at 11:26 PM Nicholas Jufas <njufas@gmail.com <mailto:njufas@gmail.com>> wrote:
> Hi Heath,
>
> Thanks for thinking of me. I just had a look through the website. It looks very nice.
>
> For someone like me, there would be no point in having a clinic presence, as I am the only practitioner in my clinic.
>
> I'm happy to be involved and be listed on your site
>
> There are a few of points I'm not sure on
>
> 1) I'm at a point where my referrals are keeping me busy enough and I have a waiting list to see me. I can see how this would benefit a new surgeon who has just finished training, but how would this fit into my practice?
> 2) Referral letters are often terrible - unless you know the GP, often they are inaccurate and don't give much information. This doesn't really allow one to "cherry pick" (almost like being blindfolded while you are picking).
> 3) Even if a patient uploads their referrals and you were to pick them, what guarantees that they will come to see you and not feel you are too far away from them geographically or they don't like you and refuse?
>
> Nicholas
>
>
>
>
>
> On Fri, Jul 31, 2020 at 4:20 PM Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
> Hi Nicholas,
>
> Hope you have been well.
>
> Just checking in to make sure you received my previous email and to gauge your interest. If you have had a chance to check out smartreferral.com.au <http://smartreferral.com.au/> I would also love any feedback you can provide?
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
>
>
>
> On Wed, Jul 29, 2020 at 11:27 AM Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
> Hi Nicholas,
>
> Hope you have been well. It's great to see the Hearing You site out in the 'wild'. I'm keen to see how the market responds.
>
> Now to the purpose of my email - I have something exciting that I’m keen to share with you. We have established a complimentary venture to our current online offerings. It’s a website which is positioned to give patients more choice in their medical journey. We are ‘flipping’ the current way that patients are engaging medical specialists. Our platform enables us to put validated patients (more specifically their referral letters), directly in front of the most appropriate specialists, allowing them to ‘cherry pick’ the cases of most relevance to them.
>
> There is also a strong online directory component, where by you can publish articles to help with your SEO, link off to authority pages such as AHPRA and be associated with hospitals and clinics that you practice at. Here are some demo links for you to review:
>
> Lakeview microsite: (FYI we are loading in circa 80 NSW based hospitals this week):
> https://smartreferral.com.au/hospital/lakeview-private-hospital/ <https://smartreferral.com.au/hospital/lakeview-private-hospital/>
>
> Clinic microsite:
> https://smartreferral.com.au/clinic/orthopaedic-associates/ <https://smartreferral.com.au/clinic/orthopaedic-associates/>
>
> Specialist microsite:
> https://smartreferral.com.au/specialist/dr-kalman-piper/ <https://smartreferral.com.au/specialist/dr-kalman-piper/>.
>
> And finally here is the link with all of the inclusions and membership model:
> https://smartreferral.com.au/specialists/ <https://smartreferral.com.au/specialists/>
>
> I'm keen to hear your thoughts and to receive feedback as to how this may fit into your current business model. I'm currently reaching out to ENT's for our initial onboarding and would love to have you on board to represent the North in your field.
>
> Feel free to call, email or book in and appointment: https://calendly.com/heathmaguire/30min <https://calendly.com/heathmaguire/30min> to discuss further, happy to answer any questions.
>
> Thanks and speak soon,
>
> --
>
